conclusion: Consider forces on each segment and calculate resultant force.
Wire consists of segments AB and BC, both perpendicular to magnetic field and current.
Each segment experiences a magnetic force F = BIL.
For segment AB, magnetic field directed into the plane.
Force on AB is F_AB = BIL, directed perpendicular to field and current.
For segment BC, magnetic field directed out of the plane.
Force on BC is F_BC = BIL, directed perpendicular to field and current.
Force on AB directed to the left, force on BC directed to the right.
Resolve forces into components due to 120° angle.
Horizontal components: F_AB,x = BIL cos(60°), F_BC,x = BIL cos(60°).
Calculate net force: F_AB,x = BIL * 1/2, F_BC,x = BIL * 1/2.
Resultant force is sum of horizontal components.
